availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eveline Johnson. Father of Joel M. Johnson, John W. Johnson, James R. Johnson, Sarah F. Johnson, Mary K. Johnson, Noah N. Johnson, and Thomas E. Johnson. Commissioner and first sheriff of Webster County. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky,
Webster County, p. 91. Minerva Bone Bassett, Some Webster County, Kentucky Families: Baker, Bassett, Givens, Johnson, Payne, Price, Rice, and Others (Baltimore: Gateway Press, Inc., 1983), 76. "An Act to Establish the County of Webster," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: J. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 76.
